title.narrative: Community Assets Building for Livelihoods and Environmental Sustainability for Luzon (CABLES-Luzon)

description.narrative: The project will assist 1719 families (623 original and 1096 pass on tribal and displaced families in Luzon, particularly in the Cordillera Region and Isabela Province. In five years, these partner families shall get 67 water buffalo, 141 beef cattle, 745 goats, 419 pigs, and 4252 chickens, 480 ducks and 2000 fish fingerlings. Heifer’s values-based holistic intervention will assist these families in evolving their communities into learning and helping communities with sustained income, food, and farming activities in a stable agro-ecology system. Families will receive livestock, tools, equipment, Cornerstones training, planting materials and facilities to develop sustainable farming systems that integrate livestock, crops and related micro-enterprises. They will be assisted to form group savings scheme adapted to their culture. In addition, participants will undergo series of trainings and learning activities to improve skills and capacity to manage and sustain their projects. Each project group will have a trained animal health worker to ensure delivery of key services in animal breeding, veterinary care and protection. Project partners and other agencies will be mobilized to provide basic health and sanitation services. The project will likewise promote values-based and gender equity practices to enhance cooperation, sharing or resources and women participation.
